msItemStruct.note: Measurements not available. Dates follow D. B. Redford (ed.), The Oxford Encyclopedia of Ancient Egypt. The use of modern symbols for the zodiacal signs indicates that only the ideograms are used in the text. In line 2, the reading of 10 is clear. The other number could be either 5, 6 or 8. The position of the moon given in line 5 would be exactly correct if one read 16. The mention of the moon in line 3 seems to be meaningless as it is mentioned again in line 5. The house of the provision of life is the "lucrum" of classical astrology.

layout.ab: Source of description: On recto: horoscope

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.

div.ab: O. MH 3377, recto: (1) Year 43 (2) month I, day 16(?), 8 o'clock of (3) the day. The moon in(?) (4) The sun in [sign of Virgo] (and) Mercury. (5) The moon in Taurus 21 degrees. (6) The ascendant: Sagittarius (and) Mars. (7) The descendant: [sign of Gemini]. (8) The lake of the sky: [sign of Virgo]. (9) The Dwat: Pisces. (10) The middle sewshep: Scorpius (and) Saturn. Libra (10a) Jupiter. (11) The right (=western) sewshep: Leo. (12) [The] left (=eastern) sewshep: Aquarius. (13) The right (=western) tewer: [sign of Virgo]. (14) The left (=eastern) tewer: Capricornus. (15) The house of provision of life: Capricornus.
